Description: Textile (garment?); irregular fragment of tartan silk, red ground with stripes in yellow, white and blue; silk and cotton; extended tabby and compound tabby. Centre of composite stripes in weft direction are in a kind of two lat compound tabby, binding with only half of the warp threads. Warp ends near selvedge are paired from 32cm. Warp: S-twist silk, ca 28 ends/cm Weft: S-twist silk, Z-spun linen?, ca 19 paired picks/cm Edge: one plain selvedge, other edges ragged. No sewing.
Condition: Good; colour good; fragmentary - conservation (unknown date): stuck to a sticky net.
